data.text:
The Institute of Supply Chain Management is proud to announce the "India Supply Chain Thought Leadership Summit" on 19th September 2024 at The Lalit, Mumbai. We welcome you to the India Supply Chain Thought Leadership Summit (ISCTLS), the premier event for senior leaders in supply chain management. Featuring star speakers whose companies have demonstrated excellence in supply chain transformation, this summit is a unique platform for thought leadership. Selected based on #ISCMsupplchainranking by #InstituteofSupplyChainManagement, our speakers are the champions of supply chain innovation. In an era marked by global macroeconomic shifts, geopolitical tensions, climate challenges, and commercial disruptions, the necessity to reimagine, rethink, and redesign supply chains has never been more critical. Amidst these changes, India stands out with its remarkable rise, prompting a transformative approach to supply chain management. Join us at ISCTLS to explore how Indian firms are innovating and reshaping their supply chains to adapt to these dynamic conditions. Discover emerging best practices as over 250 supply chain leaders come together for this exclusive event, offering unparalleled peer-to-peer learning and networking opportunities. Embrace the future of #supplychainmanagement and transform your strategies to thrive in this new era. To know more write to events@iscmforums.com

Join us for an enlightening panel discussion on Think Global Act Local: Developing Global Leadership, for the Workplace of the Future that explores the essential qualities of global leadership, moderated by Krishan Guptaa, Managing Director of Organic Wellness Products Private Limited. We are thrilled to introduce our esteemed panelists, each a leader in their respective fields, who will share insights and strategies for developing global leadership skills in the ever-evolving workplace of the future. Meet Our Distinguished Panelists: S.Y. Siddiqui - Former Board Member, Maruti Suzuki India Limited Dr. Sujata Shahi - Vice Chancellor, IILM University, Gurugram Dr. Vinod Kumar Singh - CEO, Power Sector Skill Council. Vivek Tripathi - CHRO, Newgen Software. Ravi Kumar Jain - Founding Director, Sparsh Global Business School. In a world where businesses are increasingly interconnected, global leadership has become paramount for success. Our panelists, with their extensive experience and diverse perspectives, will provide valuable insights into the skills, mindsets, and strategies that leaders need to excel in the global arena. This is an incredible opportunity to learn from industry leaders who are paving the way for organizations to thrive while making a positive impact on society and the environment. Register now to learn from the experts! Indra Nooyi: Pioneering Leadership in Global Business Indra Nooyi has made an indelible mark on the corporate world as the former CEO and Chairman of PepsiCo. Her leadership, strategic vision, and commitment to innovation have not only transformed PepsiCo but also set a high standard for business leaders globally. Assessing Indra Nooyi's GT Index: Resources Available: Indra Nooyi’s early life was marked by a supportive family and a strong educational foundation. Family Support and Educational Opportunities: 8/10 Born in Chennai, India, Indra Nooyi benefited from a supportive family that prioritized education. She attended top schools, including Madras Christian College and the Indian Institute of Management, Calcutta, providing her with a solid educational background. Advanced Education and Early Career Opportunities: 8/10 Indra pursued further studies at Yale School of Management, which equipped her with advanced business knowledge and opened doors to significant career opportunities. Early roles at companies like Johnson & Johnson and Motorola Solutions were instrumental in shaping her career. Average Resources Score: (8 + 8) / 2 = 8 Fortune Made: Indra Nooyi’s career at PepsiCo and her influence in the corporate world highlight her remarkable achievements and lasting impact. Career Success and Corporate Leadership: 10/10 As CEO of PepsiCo from 2006 to 2018, Indra led the company through a period of significant growth and strategic transformation. Her focus on healthier products and sustainability initiatives positioned PepsiCo as a forward-thinking leader in the industry. Influence and Recognition: 9/10 Indra Nooyi has been consistently recognized for her leadership and influence, appearing on numerous lists of the world’s most powerful women. Her contributions extend beyond business to various boards and advisory roles, showcasing her broad impact. Average Fortune Score: (10 + 9) / 2 = 9.5 GT Index Calculation: GT Index = Fortune Made / Resources Available GT Index = 9.5 / 8 ≈ 1.19 Inspiration and Legacy: Indra Nooyi’s legacy is characterized by her transformative leadership and her commitment to driving positive change in business practices. Her journey from Chennai to the helm of a global corporation inspires countless individuals, particularly women and minorities, to aspire to leadership roles. Celebrating Indra Nooyi’s journey from a supportive family in Chennai to leading PepsiCo as a global business icon. Her strategic vision and commitment to innovation continue to inspire leaders worldwide. #IndraNooyi #Leadership #GTIndex #Inspiration #BusinessIcon

Had an incredible time at the YPO-Mini Retreat in Bangalore – an experience that was truly one of a kind. YPO has pulled off an amazing event, with a well-curated itinerary but the personal connections forged were unparalleled. And The Highlight? The session with Rishad Premji, the current Executive Chairman of Wipro. It was truly enriching. There's something exceptional about listening to the insights of fellow accomplished personalities. You don’t only learn what they say, but also perceive how they think and approach their work and life. I saw Rishad in a new light altogether! And have to say, he inherits immense depth and humility in his thoughts from his father, Mr. Azim Premji. Have to say, his session was a new worldview about the 3 aspects of an enterprise– leadership, management, and ownership. Rishad's belief in being absolutely true and honest with his leaders, empowering them with authority to lead from the forefront, is rare. People often miss on this perspective. If leaders feel themselves as an integral part of the organization, the roots of success deepen, and the company flourishes as a united force. One must think broad and add value at the enterprise level rather investing their time in micro-management- an important understanding for today's Chairman’s and MD’s. Gratitude to YPO Punjab and Bangalore YPO Gold Chapters for uniting exceptional leaders on one platform. I am honoured to have shared insights and experiences with them. #entrepreneurship #life #leadership #management
